mesquite.lib.characters

Interface CharacterHistory

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AdjustableDistribution, CharacterStatesHolder, Explainable, Listable, Renamable, WithStringDetails
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    SlicedCharacterHistory
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CategoricalHistory, ContinuousHistory, DNACharacterHistory, MeristicHistory, ProteinCharacterHistory, RNACharacterHistory

    public interface CharacterHistory
extends AdjustableDistribution, Explainable
    Stores the states at all the nodes of a tree. Has methods to set and get the character states, and to survey the assigned states to determine the colors that could be used for character tracing. Often returned by modules reconstructing ancestral states. See general discussion of character storage classes under CharacterState

      clones given CharacterHistory.

      gets colors and statesnames of states in reconstruction.
      long getNumResolutions(Tree tree)
      for MPRs, etc., gets the number of resolutions of the history
      CharacterDistribution getObservedStates()
      Returns the observed states in the terminal taxa (used if History is reconstruction)
      CharacterHistory getResolution(Tree tree, CharacterHistory resultStates, long i)
      for MPRs, etc., gets the ith resolution of the history
      CharacterDistribution getStatesAtTips(Tree tree)
      Returns a new object indicating the states at the tips (used whether or not History is reconstruction)

      surveys states at nodes to prepare use of getColorsAtNode.

      • getColorSequenceAtNode

        ColorEventVector getColorSequenceAtNode(int node,
                                        MesquiteColorTable stateColors)
        returns the vector of ColorEvents in order, e.g. for stochastic character mapping. Return null if none

      • getColorsOfState

        int getColorsOfState(CharacterState state,
                     ColorDistribution colors,
                     MesquiteColorTable stateColors)
        places into the already instantiated ColorDistribution the colors corresponding to the CharacterState, and returns the number of colors. Uses default colors. Mode is MesquiteColorTable.GRAYSCALE, COLORS, COLORS_NO_BW, or DEFAULT (default depends on subclass)
